body: I'm fine either way.  If its not merged when I get back to this code this evening, I'll make the change.  The build failures are still not related to my code.
Hi Guys, I've just applied, double checked that the super class creates a new set so that should be safe, Andriy, hope you are OK, we can always tweak few things in the source too :-).
:+1:  wanted to merge but you did it first :) Thanks @johnament @sberyozkin !
oops :-), Sorry Andriy :-)
Sorry - just realized the commits weren't squashed.  Fixed
IMO, looks cleaner, thanks @johnament, leaving decision to @sberyozkin as he authored or/and worked on these examples.
I believe the test failures are unrelated to my change.

John, does the demo work without a version qualifier of the final jar, when it is started with a "java -jar" ? Also as a side note I'm not convinced -Pserver does not make sense for the server only applications as it hides the specific plugin options - but I'm fine with getting rid of them whenever possible
Well we can make spring boot the default goal.  I'm not sure about your question though.  This just changes the file name and I've been able to run the examples with these instructions....

While I appreciate this quality patch I'd like to say that the way the spring_boot_scan server and client applications are started is really off topic for CXF-7093, however as I noted I can def live with asking users to do 'mvn spring-boot:run' again instead of -Pserver or -Pclient. Re "java -jar" - I'll experiment tomorrow....

I'm not sure what you mean.  That didn't change other than the way mvn is called - mvn -Pclient/server vs mvn spring-boot:run for all 3 modules.  If you want me to make that work I can.  The problem is that the wrong spring boot version was getting used..
Could anyone review and push this PR to upstream?
@ffang : can you review this to make sure this doesn't conflict with or duplicate the async changes you already made this week.

Hi,

thank you for reviewing this merge request. I have been able to reproduce the problem even with the code using the timer task to remove the callback from the exchange.

About the merge request, I cannot reproduce the failing test org.apache.cxf.systest.jaxrs.sse.tomcat.TomcatBroadcasterTest.testBooksStreamIsBroadcasted on my environment.
moved to PR #194 to change source branch to cxf_beanvalidation_annot
Johannes, please start from the latest email discussion and proceed from there, thanks. Lets put all this XML schema + Bean Validation on hold for now
Looks like the failures are not related to CDI... https://builds.apache.org/job/CXF-Trunk-PR/200/
Thanks a lot for the fix, @johnament, will work on merging tonight
should loadResourceProviders support not normal-scoped instances too (doesn't ATM it seems)?

@johnament think singleton per default is fine (even good) but I don't think it works. Add a @PreDestroy releasing a socket pool (http pool to get some meta config for instance) and you will just leak this since the creational context is not released.
@rmannibucau @johnament I think the CdiResourceProvider should be involved more here. The creation context could be released when `release` call happens.

@rmannibucau yes, that is the other problem.  But that's been a long standing issue with leaking instances, way before my time.  I'll clean that up though.  Raised https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/CXF-7134

@reta Yes, I agree.  That's where I plan to put the `release`.

Ok, I added a couple more commits to this.  I'm not 100% happy with CXF-7134 but don't want to block a potential release.

What I'm seeing is that validation feature doesn't get registered on the JAX-RS resource when I move the creational context to the point of getting the instance.  Need to debug a bit further, but I think this is OK to merge for now.  Just leave 7134 open I'll clean up further.

Hey @johnament , could you please create a separate PRs for these commits? I am about to close the original one, related to @RequestScoped. Now things may get complicated :-) 
Thanks!
I can.  I wasn't sure if you were holding off due to the conversation here.
I have taken the approach we have discussed, moving more responsibilities to CdiResourceProvider, I think I have gotten a bit cleaner implementation.
Had a discussion with @ffang and decided that this was not a good fit for CXF. Thanks for the consideration!

Thanks for the patch - note I had to set this new property to 'true' by default - to preserve the original filter behaviour with respect to how it authenticates when acquiring the token and fix the CXF test failure

Per comment on woodstox issue (https://github.com/FasterXML/woodstox/issues/29#issuecomment-264719777), the reader is working as expected and cxf should process its input accordingly. This pr fixes that.

Thanks for the patch, note it contains an older fix which I've already applied on your behalf earlier. I did a minor tweak and added a utility method to JAXRSUtils to keep the set of streaming classes there, hope you are ok with that. The checkstyle was failing, may be because you had a wildcard import which is probably not supported by the checkstyle. The commit is going now, thanks
Jenkins test errors are in unrelated modules.

There is a single test failure (see https://builds.apache.org/job/CXF-Trunk-PR/org.apache.cxf.systests$cxf-systests-ws-rm/269/testReport/org.apache.cxf.systest.ws.rm/SequenceTest/testOnewayAnonymousAcksSuppressed/), however that seems to be unrelated to the above changes.
Can someone please close this PR? It doesn't make sense to merge all commits from 3.1.x-fixes to master. Jenkins is continuously building the PR and spamming me with unrelated notification mails...
Can you please update this patch so that only the proposed changes are visible ? Looks like some format-related changes made into it too
Why CXF starters depending on 1.4.3 is problematic when they are used with 1.5.1 containers ?
The problem is described in CXF-7198. I think CXF should use the latest Spring Boot version, samples should also be based on that. I've opened another PR #233 for it.
That problem was fixed earlier, I don't get how upgrading the version to 1.5.1 adds anything to what was already fixed

See my comments to #232. The actual version upgrade does not change anything in CXF but a change to a new major SpringBoot dep. This is not a bad idea in itself - but will we break 1.4.x SpringBoot users if we start inadvertently utilizing 1.5.x features where 1.4.x is still not exactly old ?

In other words, given that it was confirmed CXF starters can now work with 1.5.x, I think that we should only upgrade to 1.5.x if we start using 1.5.x features inside CXF starters - to make sure CXF Spring Boot 1.4.x and 1.5.x users can use the startes
Ok.
I've opened https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/CXF-7237 to get this issue tracked and be more visible, thanks
I have applied with some changes in formatting. Thanks for the contribution. For new pull requests better keep them in a branch instead of master.

Hi Christian,
thanks for the hint - it was my first pull request, apparently there had to be something going wrong ;)
Greets,
Michel

No problem.
Please also remember to close the PR once the changes are applied unless it auto closes.
Btw. If you have changes in your PR you do not need to create a new PR. You can add commits and you can even use git reset to undo several commits, put them into one commit and do a push -f. While this is bad in master it is ok on a branch that only you work on.
Christian
please use #233 to merge as it covers areas which I missed to look at
I tried to look into the Jenkins test failures, and they seem unrelated to me, but I'll admit I don't really understand how they all work... So I could be wrong about that.
Thanks for the patch, I've added a 'jaxb' prefix to the property name given that using JAXB can be optional and other strategies can be used
This PR is now obsolet as the update was done. So please close it...
Sergey, can I now supply such patch for 3.1.11 branch ?
I've already back merged it into 3.1.11-SNAPSHOT
Thanks!
Thanks for the patch
@sberyozkin , can you please let me know how to use 3.2.0-SNAPSHOT so that I can integrate with Spring-boot-1.5.1
Just use the snapshot repo: http://repository.apache.org/snapshots/org/apache/cxf/
Hi Dennis, is it related to the client proxy thing ?
yes but in my view this should be fixed in any case
Closed as discussed in https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/CXF-7316.
Don't worry about the build timing out. Any chance of modifying/adding some tests for these new features?
I just noticed that it also works with the old version of maven-bundle-plugin. So #260 is enough.
@coheigea As you can see I have modified the unit tests in my last commit, so they runs well again.

The unit tests have been modified, but I'd prefer to see a unit test added that (for example) failed with the old code but passes with the new code. Does changing from "add" to "set" for arrays break the API by the way?
I agree, I'd just override createJaxrsServer, if AppPath is there then complete it otherwise delegate to the superclass, I can take care of it while working on your patch

@andymc12 , actually I expected a concern about this, that's why I opened up a PR instead of committing directly. I'm not sure we want to keep the former behavior wrt supporting null keys. I don't think entries with null keys were actually used before, null keys happened to be "supported" because of the internal implementation detail choice. This said I believe the code that I fixed is not calling remove(null) on purpose, basically the change in CXF-5407 is exposing a bug that was there before.
@dkulp what's your opinion on this?
Thanks, does CXF run in-fault interceptors on the server side ? May be I'm wrong, need to double check, I thought they were only run on the client side.

I didn't check, but I have difficulties thinking up a case for in fault interceptors. I found the issue when adding an out fault interceptor.

I added the in fault more for completeness. If somebody finds a use case at least the support is there 😁
Can you please create another PR related to JavaDocs and SpringBoot version update, thanks

I just checked, the in fault interceptors are not run (try to throw a Fault from the in interceptor) but the in interceptors.handleFault method is called. Ideally we'd not have the option to set the inFaultInterceptors at the server factory bean level; probably too sensitive modify the API at this stage
Never mind, spring boot version was already set to 1.5.2.RELEASE on master, I'll merge javadocs updates
Ouch, thanks for spotting it. To be honest I'd rather get rid of the duplicates (in, out, out fault interceptors) at the AbstractSpringComponentScanServer
Makes sense, I introduced some add methods.
Thanks, ended just adding them directly to the returned lists

I actually think doing "both" would be the right thing to do.   The fix in this PR is likely correct as calling remove with a null key is pointless as there shouldn't ever be a null "Set" of classes as a key in the cache.  Possibly and empty set, but likely not a null set.

However, protecting against it in the CacheMap is also a good thing.
@andymc12 @dkulp  I've added another commit for the changes in the CacheMap, hopefully this should be enough.
Yea... that looks good to me.
OK, thanks, I've merged the PR.
Hi Andy, this fix looks good, please go ahead with the merge, thanks
Definitely concerned about the set->add change.  That will certainly break peoples code.   Can the original method be retained with the add method being added?
Closed as too old pr
Hi David, I'd rather restore the ability to pass a custom logging category. Service qname can be configured for jaxrs endpoingts too, so this SOAP and REST markers will just cause the confusion
Actually, it looks OK, I was concerned that a 'REST' will be printed for every REST request in the default case :-). Looks good to me.

Hi, thanks for the patch. Can you please consider locking at the AbstractOAuthDataProvider level instead, so that all its extensions (JPA2, JCache, Ehcache and future ones like Mongo-based) can benefit ?
I'd consider introducing 'Object refreshTokenLock' and use it to lock at https://github.com/apache/cxf/blob/master/rt/rs/security/oauth-parent/oauth2/src/main/java/org/apache/cxf/rs/security/oauth2/provider/AbstractOAuthDataProvider.java#L211

Let me know please if it works for you

PRs are validated using a Jenkins build. https://builds.apache.org/view/A-D/view/CXF/

Why do we need Travis?

Viacheslav, the patch has been applied with minor updates to let people use a Java lock if they prefer (JPA2 provider is currently using the pessimistic lock as per your code).

However the test fails so I disabled it - can you please have a look and also copy it it to JPACMTOAuthDataProviderOpenJPATest class to make sure it works with OpenJPA - to make sure we don't break the JPA2 provider depending on OpenJPA ? Thanks

You're right,

At the time I proposed this PR I thought it could be helpful to enable quickly a build on it own forked repository.
CXF-6904 is resolved so this should be closed as well, shouldn't it?
CXF-5118 is resolved so this should be closed as well, shouldn't it?

Please rebase and check if the changes are still needed. AbstractLoggingInterceptor from cxf-core is deprecated, there is now org.apache.cxf.ext.logging.AbstractLoggingInterceptor in cxf-rt-features-logging.
Please add a testcase to AnnotationHandlerChainBuilderTest.
CXF-6706 is resolved so this should be closed as well, shouldn't it?
CXF-7000 and CXF-7047 are resolved so this should be closed as well, shouldn't it?
CXF-7070 and CXF-7075 are resolved so this should be closed as well, shouldn't it?
CXF-7201 is resolved so this should be closed as well, shouldn't it?

Thanks for the pull request. 
What is shown before and after the patch?
2.7.18 was the last release for the 2.7.x branch. Does it make sense to backport it?

@sberyozkin @deki I am not able to merge - my view of this PR says that "Only those with write access to this repository can merge pull requests."  I should have access to commit, but maybe the ACLs have not been updated on github?
Nobody can merge Apache repos on Github. Instead you should rebase your branch on Apache repo (see http://cxf.apache.org/source-repository.html), squash commits and push there.
I actually deleted my fork, but I'll review the conflicting changes and possibly rebase.
